ygData.subject: Re: bard seeks advice
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with this response.  Stratics has a couple of problems IMHO. 1.  their site is a pain in the rear to navigate.  Everything is hidden under ambiguous
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with this response. Stratics has a couple of problems IMHO.

1. their site is a pain in the rear to navigate. Everything is hidden under
ambiguous headings.

2. most of their information is pretty accurate and detailed--if this was
still eq beta 4. I would even go so far as the first couple of months of
release. they do *not* consistently keep any of their EQ content updated.

IMHO, it would be unfair to bury your site in that mire...it is too valueable
to be filed away 15 links down on a disorganized website.

Wasn't trying to sound real harsh...but i guess it came across that way :(
sorry.

--
Kaleid 23rd lvl half elf bard, prexus(retired)
Glyphed Aegiss 30th lvl dark elf magician, prexus(retired)
--
Hiro Protagonist
30th lvl wood elf druid
Secretary of Transportation
*Tears of Prexus*
Morrell-Thule
--

>The only problem I have with it is that Stratics hasn't kept up at all
>on EQ, with a lot of their content and reference pages still unchanged
>since beta. As long as their hosting wasn't exclusive I guess there'd be
>no downside but it wouldn't be very good to see the song list locked
>away on a site that hardly anyone goes to due to it's mostly out of date
>info.

>Check their bard song list, hidden away under strategy and
>statistics(tm)->class articles->bard spell list. They have 20 songs.
>I guess it's nice that they are looking for a better list now but my
>question would be; why, after over a year of total neglect, are they
>bothering?


>>On Tue, May 23/00, "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...> wrote:
>> I received an email last night from Manga of the EverQuest Stratics site.
>> They are interested in hosting the Song Analysis on their network. I
>> consider the Song Analysis to be not just mine, but all of yours as well. As
>> it would not be what it is without the combined wisdom of all the wonderful
>> bards on this mailing list and on the Concert Hall message board. Your
>> opinions on this matter mean a lot to me, so please let me know what your
>> feelings are.

>--
> Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
